availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Claiborne W. White, Sr. (Madison County, Kentucky, soldier and merchant)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, soldier and merchant. Virginia native. Married to Susan C. White. Father of Richard White, Patsy White, Claiborne White, Jr., Susan White, and Ann White. Served in Henry H. John Dixon's company of the Virginia Militia during the War of 1812. Merchant in Madison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Merchant in Madison County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Died in Madison County on March 27, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 203B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 419.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 456A.
